intro: Sanguisorba obtusa, commonly known as narrowleaf burningnettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often reddish stems. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers in late summer. Sanguisorba obtusa is characterized by its upright growth habit and is often found in moist to wet habitats such as swamps and stream banks. It is also noted for its ability to thrive in shaded environments.
